ygData.subject: Re: Price Fixing
ygData.msgSnippet: ... a.  I didn t say I sold at cost, do the math, a tunic cost way less than 15pp to make b.  at the grocery store I m not being charged outrageous fees
ygData.messageBody:
>>> "Lemac Justerian" <lemac@...> 5.20.99 2:36:08 PM >>>
>>>Oh, so do you think that the grocery store only charges you for the actual
>>>cost of the product YOU are buying? and not their 'losses' from spoilage,
>>>theft, etc?

a. I didn't say I sold at cost, do the math, a tunic cost way less than 15pp to make
b. at the grocery store I'm not being charged outrageous fees because farmer A can't produce as apples as efficiently as farmer B
c. If I feel grocery store A is charging too much I go to grocery store B and buy the same merchandise at a lower price, so its up to grocer A to lower their prices to meet consumer need/want, not up to grocer B to raise their price to match the market "standards".

>>>So yes, you do have to consider costs of failures too... If a 'client' came
>>>up to you with all the raw materials and said "Make me a tunic and I will
>>>give you 5pp." Would you tell them Okay without mentioning that it *might
>>>not* work and they would be out the 5pp for the raw materials? Or, if you
>>>failed with their materials would you then use your own until you were able
>>>to produce one for them? This would be a bad thing for you if it did... But
>>>if that is your thinking, then the heck with ME learning to smith, I am
>>>going to start ordering stuff from you all the time!!

I don't work like that, if someone came up to me and said they had the materials, I would offer to buy the materials, then charge them my normal price. But that has never happened to me...

>>>In fact, please put me down for two tunics (I will sell one for 20pp and
>>>mine will only cost 10), or better yet, make it FOUR! I can get a discount
>>>for multiples, right?? hehe... (let's see now, if I get them for 13pp each
>>>x4=52 plat... I can sell 3 x20=60... I get mine free AND make 8 plat! All
>>>without smithing!! Kewl!!)

a. I sell tunics for 15, you should read more carefully
b. people like you make me sick.....you'd take advantage of someone trying to do the community a favor (me) by buying my stuff cheap and selling at much higher prices for your own personal gain. "Screw thy fellow man" must be your motto of life.
c. You would get no such discount from me, infact I'd probably charge you 40pp per tunic due to your own greed.

>>>Of course if I order more, you should give me an even BIGGER discount
>>>because, after all, I am HELPING you to learn to be a better smith, right?
>>>Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana

I generally don't give discounts on bulk purchases because either someone is trying to take advantage of my low prices, or they are trying to twink out their guild buddies.
